data.title: The police officer who leaked the footage of the surfers paradise police brutality, where the victims blood was washed away by officers, has been criminally charged for bringing it to the publics view. Officers who did the bashing get nothing.

Thousands of prehistoric mammoth tusks are being dug out of the melting permafrost of the Arctic. They are then shipped to China for the ivory-carving industry, causing some scientists to question whether this perfectly legal trade should be banned.
Chinese troops head to border with North Korea
Heinz no longer qualifies as Ketchup in Israel. It doesn't contain enough tomato content.
S. Korea Detects Unusual Submarine Activity From North as Envoys Meet
Multiple explosions reported at US military facility in Japan
Train gunman's lawyer: He only meant to rob people, found Kalashnikov in a park near train station
N. Korean 'subs out for operations, artillery doubled,' talks with South resume
Under threat of Taliban attack, archaeologists are excavating a spectacular Buddhist complex before it’s obliterated by a huge mining operation
No Sign of End to Korea Talks as Kim Steps Up Force Mobilization
U.K. Orders Google To Forget 9 News Articles About The “Right To Be Forgotten”

Swiss army ends 31-day cow rescue mission - Crew airlifted water to thirsty cows during drought, delivering 1,840 tons of water July 20th-Aug 19. The mission suffered a minor diplomatic incident when the Swiss army took water from lakes in the French Jura.
Australia, New Zealand firefighters head to US western states to battle blazes.
Tension grows over 'lost' North Korean submarines as South Korea searches for vessels
‘A Million North Koreans Volunteer’ To Fight
